pullRequest.title: Migrate some OptionalInt's to Optional<Integer>s
pullRequest.bodyText: This change is not intended to change any functionality.

commit.message:
some moving from OptionalInt to Optional<Integer>

Signed-off-by: Ratan Rai Sur <ratan.r.sur@gmail.com>

correct assertions

Signed-off-by: Ratan Rai Sur <ratan.r.sur@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Is this change just to make it more functional style? I'd be careful doing that as it requires testing and doesn't actually improve anything.

commit.message:
fix EnodeURL tests

Signed-off-by: Ratan Rai Sur <ratan.r.sur@gmail.com>

change port

Signed-off-by: Ratan Rai Sur <ratan.r.sur@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: This is a concise argument as to why OptionalInt should be avoided.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -187,13 +186,7 @@ protected void handleIncomingPacket(final Endpoint sourceEndpoint, final Packet
         packet
             .getPacketData(PingPacketData.class)
             .flatMap(PingPacketData::getFrom)
-            .flatMap(
-                fromEndpoint -> {
-                  final OptionalInt maybePort = fromEndpoint.getTcpPort();
-                  return maybePort.isPresent()
-                      ? Optional.of(maybePort.getAsInt())
-                      : Optional.empty();
-                })
+            .flatMap(Endpoint::getTcpPort)

nodes.bodyText: Will exceptions be thrown out of this lambda construct?  We should have a unit test to validate, all the unit tests I reviewed are all within UInt16.
